content.question: The original solution used to make the solutions for the standard curve was prepared by dissolving <math alttext="2.60 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.60</mn><mspace></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C o C l 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CoCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="130 decimal point grams per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>130.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) in enough water to make <math alttext="100 decimal point milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of solution. What is the molar concentration of the solution?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
